comment: This was a weird and uneventful class. Dr. Chen wasn't really available through email, it would take a couple days for her to respond if she responded at all. I don't think I learned anything useful for the workplace, just different projects we might use...which I highly doubt. Overall she's okay and an easy grader.
rating_tags: So many papers--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: We did not receive any grades until after the course was completed, which I disliked. Many of the materials we were assigned were not accessible (e.g., videos were recorded without captioning, light text was used on a white background, and books were selected that were not available with audio versions).
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Chen is an amazing professor! I loved taking her class, even though our time was cut short due to a personal emergency she went through near the end of the semester. She truly wanted to hear what each student had to say, and it was amazing to hear about her expertise and experience. Class discussions were worth participating in!

Professor Chen gives you two weeks for each module, which is a ton of reading from certain chapters of the textbook (that she uploads) and an assignment on what you learned. Super straightforward video lectures and content. Tough to get in contact with sometimes, though.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Pretty good teacher. Ling3045 was mostly completion-based but did have a few papers worth a lot of points. A lot of reading, so be ready to put in time. Not too much to say, her videos are helpful and the material is pretty straightforward. An interesting topic and a fairly simple class if you need it.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--So many papers

comment: Super nice professor that genuinely wants you to learn about linguistics! Her course may be tough at times especially with the readings but she is always open to help ! Midterm/final were easy and interesting. Don't be intimidated by the course, she is an easy grader as long as you put in the effort, you'll be good for the class :)
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: Felt like an absent parent. She opens up the modules (oftentimes late) and just leaves us on our own. While she answers to emails quickly, she "teaches" through readings and lectures that regurgitate book information. She's generally nice.

This course was fairly easy. The assignments themselves were rather complicated, but she wasn't a tough grader. The entire course minus a few discussion posts and the midterm/final were on Google Drive, which was quite unorganized and hard to navigate. Due dates were flexible, as long as you finish assignments by the last day, you're given credit.
final and midterm were easy, its honestly an easy A but it is a bit unorganized and everything is done in google drive

Dr. Chen is really passionate about her field of study and was really good with pacing. Although we had classes canceled, she changed the calendar for us (it was in a google doc we all had access to in case of changes). Her final was easy and she didn't grade anything harshly. She was always available after class. I recommend her for sure.

Did not use D2L. 
3 graded assignments. Rest was busywork, never collected. Class met once a week but she cancelled twice, never revised the schedule, so it was no longer reliable. Was excited to learn about teaching L2 learners but instead received a sales-pitch for "corpus linguistics," which is of no use to educators or anyone outside academia.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: dr. chen is clearly very knowledgeable about linguistics, but doesn't do a good job of actually teaching. the only grades i've received so far (finals week) is the midterm grade and the first assignment's grade. lots of what feels like busy work that we've received no feedback on. the class is very unorganized. i don't recommend.

Prof Chen is very knowledgeable about the course material but seems to expect a certain level of background knowledge or achievement on the part of the student. Her graduate students seem to do fine as much of the course is clearly designed with them in mind, but on the other hand, undergrads seemed lost and confused and many stopped attending.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: This class seems a bit daunting at first because it covers a lot of content, but you are only graded on a small portion of it. Just do the readings, show up to class, and focus on the big picture. The workload was very fair, and professor Chen was always very helpful and understanding.

Professor Chen is awesome. The content for this class is quite heavy, so it does require you to read and participate in her class; but she is extremely caring and willing to give extra help to students if needed. She is so respectful and wants to see everyone succeed. I highly recommend her, especially for Ling3035!
